intro: Arequipa haynii var. erectipetala, commonly known as the upright-petaled arequipa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, upright flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
